Text.Value: I can start to do so almost immediately - the wars of late have left many with nowhere to turn... Many lost their families, their homes - some never had them to begin with.

EditorData.NodeContext: Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

Text.Value: It was necessary.
I wish it could be so... but a new task awaits me.

EditorData.NodeContext: Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

Text.Value: And so you shall, as soon as you come to visit - there will be much for you to see, and not a soul among our numbers who will not wish to praise the saviour of Baldur's Gate.

You made a choice that would cause most to tremble. You made a sacrifice far greater than merely laying down your life. Your whole future, utterly altered. The world is in your debt, and I am in awe of you.

EditorData.NodeContext: Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

Text.Value: I remember you saying you wanted to seek a way for everyone to live a better life.
I fear what awaits you will be difficult. There are few places you could go where your new form will not inspire fear, anger... violence.

EditorData.NodeContext: Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

Text.Value: I see... After all my years of living, I know all too well that nothing lasts forever. Yet a parting can sting, nonetheless.

EditorData.NodeContext: Disappointed but dignified

Text.Value: Better than Archdruid ever did. The old teachings could not have foreseen this world; I can see a new way to serve nature now - a path that all can follow, if they wish.
I wish we had been afforded more time together, but there is so much to do in the wake of the Absolute's defeat, and precious few hands with which to do it.
But still... we had best make your introduction carefully, and gradually. After all they have been through, I would hate to frighten the children - and the adults, for that matter.

EditorData.NodeContext: Caution/playfulness

Text.Value: That's my reward? Self-imposed exile?
Time will tell, I suppose. I'm a busy man.
Time will tell, I suppose. I'm a busy woman.
Time will tell, I suppose. I'm a busy adventurer.
Halsin, I... I can't... my engine...
A new community, raised by your hands? I'd like to see that.
It is the better of two beasts. At least I did not become Bhaal's.
*You try to answer, but a tide of searing-hot pain crashes over you.*
Farewell. I hope our paths cross again in the future.
You are afraid because you are alive, and you have something to lose. Hold on to that.

EditorData.NodeContext: Sincere. Talking to Karlach, his love interest who has potentially-fatal infernal condition.

Text.Value: I thought that last night would have proven otherwise. I know your true nature. It is still there. It still intoxicates me.

EditorData.NodeContext:
Romanrtic longing, seeing through the player's new form
Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

Text.Value: What about us?
Do not torment yourself with paths not taken. You did what was necessary.

EditorData.NodeContext: Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

Text.Value: I thought that would be the steepest price that could be asked of us. But I was wrong.

EditorData.NodeContext: Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

Text.Value: It was a mistake. There must have been another way.
But I know what you did. I shall not forget, and I shall make it my purpose to tell all of what you did for them.

EditorData.NodeContext: Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

Text.Value: If this is what you truly want... I shall respect your wishes. But know that you shall not die - not truly. Nature's realm shall be yours. In the air, the trees, the waters.

EditorData.NodeContext: Sadded but respectful. Talking to Karlach, his love interest who has potentially-fatal infernal condition.

Text.Value: Well... then let us make haste. You have quite a few little fans who will be overjoyed to make your acquaintance.

EditorData.NodeContext: Delighted/eager.

Text.Value: I saved the world. I deserve better.

Perhaps in time, I can trust them to meet their saviour. Perhaps you can come to visit us, and be treated with all the reverence you deserve. That day may be distant. But I shall do everything in my power to hasten it.

EditorData.NodeContext:
A little hopeful that this may not be goodbye forever.
Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

Text.Value: Of course - somehow I'd hoped for a miracle. But of course, the only miracles are those we make ourselves.

EditorData.NodeContext: Solemn - talking to Karlach, his love interest who has potentially-fatal infernal condition.

Text.Value: What comes next?
They need help - help that this city cannot provide right now. I shall aid them to make a new place for themselves, in Thaniel's realm, under nature's watch.

EditorData.NodeContext: Impassioned/Proud

Text.Value: I'm not sure I can, Halsin. Not alone.
Would you go with me?
'Visit as soon as I can?' Don't be an ass, Halsin. I'll come with you right now.
Because I am. At least for now.

EditorData.NodeContext: Bittersweet.

Text.Value: Now is the time for us to take care of each other. Already, people are gathering to depart. The promise of a new life inspires great haste.

EditorData.NodeContext: Sincere and passionate.

Text.Value: Do not be so modest - you gave as good as you got.

EditorData.NodeContext: A little cheeky

Text.Value: Do as you must, as shall I. We shall meet again. It is as sure as the break of dawn, or the spring thaw.

EditorData.NodeContext: Sincere/romantic.Talking to Karlach, his love interest who has potentially-fatal infernal condition.

Text.Value: No - never. I'd rather die here than try to survive there. All I want now is to see the sky one last time.
A new start must be without limits, or otherwise how would we ever know what we are capable of?

EditorData.NodeContext: Reconsidering a little. Could he actually find a way to stay with his mind flayer lover?

Text.Value: You are right, of course. There are no mistakes in nature - it is all a grand tapestry beyond mortal reckoning.

EditorData.NodeContext: Understanding/thoughtful

Text.Value: But that just means what we shared was precious, and will live on in my memory. Thank you - I am a richer man for having met you.

EditorData.NodeContext: Dignified/soulful

Text.Value: At least... for now, they depend on me. But perhaps given time, their roots will grow strong enough that they can stand without me.

EditorData.NodeContext: Some hope.Talking to Karlach, his love interest who has potentially-fatal infernal condition.

Text.Value: To Avernus? The land of lost souls...? I cannot. There are people who depend on me now.

EditorData.NodeContext: Torn between lover and responsibilities. Talking to Karlach, his love interest who has potentially-fatal infernal condition.

Text.Value: You must visit as soon as you can - there will be much for you to see, and not a soul among our numbers who will not wish to praise the saviour of Baldur's Gate.
... are you truly sure?

EditorData.NodeContext: bated breath.

Text.Value: You... you shall? But what about all that you'll miss out on? Your name will be feted in this city - there will be parades, medals, feasts, hands to be shaken, babies to be kissed...

EditorData.NodeContext: Taken aback/doesn't dare to hope the player is being serious.

Text.Value: You live your life, and I shall live mine... but forgive me the odd hopeful glance towards the horizon, in search for you.

EditorData.NodeContext: Understandng, with some hope/sign he'll still hold a candle for you

Text.Value: It seems your dream of a better life for all might just come to pass.
This need not be a parting, so long as you fight on. You and I can each roam apart, until nature compels our paths to cross once again.

EditorData.NodeContext: Some hope.Talking to Karlach, his love interest who has potentially-fatal infernal condition.

Text.Value: What comes now?
I feared this would be the case...
Try to focus. The inferno in your chest is reaching fever pitch.
You shall live on. And wherever I go, I shall feel your presence, and you mine.

EditorData.NodeContext: Sincere. Talking to Karlach, his love interest who has potentially-fatal infernal condition.

Text.Value: You could come with me.
I cannot. No matter how much I want to.

EditorData.NodeContext: Full of longing.

Text.Value: You do. But I fear the world is ignorant to its debt, at least for now.

EditorData.NodeContext: Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

Text.Value: And I... well, I shall have my own selfish reasons for wanting to see you again, if you wish the same.

EditorData.NodeContext: A little romantic longing,

Text.Value: Because you are wise. You know the fear and mistrust that can grip people's hearts all too easily. There are cruel limits to who they can accept as their saviour.

EditorData.NodeContext: Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

Text.Value: I have responsibilities. People who are counting on me. But perhaps given time, their roots will grow strong enough that they can stand without me.

EditorData.NodeContext: Some hope.Talking to Karlach, his love interest who has potentially-fatal infernal condition.

Text.Value: No. I think our paths are meant to diverge here.
When we joined battle for the last time, I did not want to presume we would survive. To feel your touch again seemed like a distant dream. That made last night all the sweeter.

EditorData.NodeContext: Sincere, romantic

Text.Value: Forget the world - stay with me.
A sorry prize, yes. One that I wish was not so... but the world has a narrow view of who can be its saviour.

EditorData.NodeContext: Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

Text.Value: I've never been more sure. Ready when you are.
Why do I get the feeling you're about to say goodbye?
You need to remove yourself from that danger - go wherever you can find solitude, peace. Nature's realm is vast - it shall provide a place where you can be yourself.

EditorData.NodeContext: Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

Text.Value: It suits you.
Awe? You don't find me... unnatural?
Then I will watch the horizon for you each day, and fix your image in my mind each night, until I feel your touch again.

EditorData.NodeContext: Pleased

Text.Value: Part of me wishes we could stay in this room forever, you and I... but there is a new dawn breaking. And I have a part to play.

EditorData.NodeContext: Bittersweet

Text.Value: You sell yourself short - this is your dream. If you want me to be part of it, your followers will listen.
Perhaps I'm being hasty. Perhaps we should go our separate ways.
Karlach - you are in pain. Do not say otherwise. It is writ large across your face.

EditorData.NodeContext: Concerned - talking to Karlach, his love interest who has potentially-fatal infernal condition.

Text.Value: You can still save yourself, Karlach. You can return to Avernus. It need not be forever. Just long enough to give yourself a chance.

EditorData.NodeContext: Unwilling to give up - talking to Karlach, his love interest who has potentially-fatal infernal condition.

Text.Value: Have no fear. I am exceedingly patient.

EditorData.NodeContext: Undaunted and confident in the face of the player's coyness.

Text.Value: We are each free, as we always were... but that does not need to be the end.

EditorData.NodeContext: 'You know me - I'm a free agent'

Text.Value: I am glad you feel that way, for I fear what awaits you will be difficult. There are few places you could go where your new form will not inspire fear, anger... violence.

EditorData.NodeContext: Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

Text.Value: Not to mention exhausting. I don't know where you get your energy from.
At last count, there were nine whole wagons of children in tow. They are my duty now. 'Daddy Halsin', they call me. Who am I to tell them otherwise?

EditorData.NodeContext: Indulgent chuckle and shake of the head on 'Daddy Halsin'.

Text.Value: But I fear what awaits you will be difficult. There are few places you could go where your new form will not inspire fear, anger... violence.

EditorData.NodeContext: Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

Text.Value: The wars of late have left many with nowhere to turn... Many lost their families, their homes - some never had them to begin with.

EditorData.NodeContext: Impassioned

Text.Value: As do I. Be safe. Seek peace. Let nature guard you and provide for you. And know that there are those who will keep you in their hearts, always.

EditorData.NodeContext:
A little hopeful that this may not be goodbye forever.
Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

Text.Value: I could seek you out, or you could return to me, if Avernus were to yield a cure.

EditorData.NodeContext: Some hope.Talking to Karlach, his love interest who has potentially-fatal infernal condition.

Text.Value: It is but a sprouting acorn for now, but given time and care, it could grow tall and mighty - and offer shelter to all who need it.

EditorData.NodeContext: Modest but hopeful for the future

Text.Value: When we joined battle for the last time, I did not want to presume we would survive. I assumed it might cost us our lives in order to save nature's realm.

EditorData.NodeContext: Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

Text.Value: Let us try. It would be a sorry dream that does not make room for all who would wish to partake in it. Nature will find its balance, and if we are worthy, it will provide us with harmony.

EditorData.NodeContext: Throwing caution to the wind/giving tentacle love a chance.

Text.Value: I do, trust me.
Our hearts roam free, remember? Tend to your new dream - our paths will cross if it's meant to be.
That would surely test even the most open-minded... yet, perhaps I am wrong to hesitate.

EditorData.NodeContext: Reconsidering a little. Could he actually find a way to stay with his mind flayer lover?

Text.Value: I'm afraid, Halsin.
You're leaving?

Synopsis: Halsin addresses a player to whom he's romantically linked  in a private room in the Elfsong tavern. They discuss what comes next. This scene occurs shortly after the final victory over the absolute, a day or so after the battle. Player and Halsin are implied to have spent the night together.
